intro: Pentapera sicula subsp. libanotica, commonly known as the Lebanese pentapera, is a rare and endemic species found primarily in the Mediterranean region. It is a shrub characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or calcareous soils, often in dry, sunny habitats. Its botanical features include a woody stem and a distinctive flowering pattern that occurs in late spring. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
